This is an awesome hidden gem just a few blocks from the shops at Passage de Gracia.  We didn't make reservation but didn't have to wait for a table.  the ambience was contemporary chic.  We sat at a table overlooking the kitchen and the dishes coming out had us salivating!!!! The food was soooo great and the pricing soooo reasonable.   We were a party of 2 and both ordered the tapas pre-fixe menu for only 19 euros each.  They gave you a glass of cava PLUS a whole pitcher of sangria with this menu. First course was a big salad.  Second course was a sizable portion of assorted cured meat with bread.  It was a great selection of Spanish ham.  Next was a well prepared and refreshing roasted red pepper dish with little cubes of ham.  My fave dish of the menu was the blood sausage with chorizo and fried green pepper.  The blood sausage was mixed with sticky rice and complemented the spicy chorizo perfectly.  The green peppers were tasty.  Then came an egg casserole which served with slices of potatoes pan-grilled in duck foie and two over-easy eggs.  It tasted so much better than it sounded on paper.  The last meat dish was the grilled prawns which were fresh and flavorful.  The finale of a creme bulee style cream rounded out this big meal.  I normally opted for seafood dishes at Barcelona but this menu widened my view of Catalan crusine.  You won't regret coming here!!!
